text: in the u.s. McDonald's is just another
fast-food chain it's never your first
option to satisfy your hunger but in
Thailand McDonald is not only a proper
restaurant it's a revolution and I
actually enjoy eating here
[Music]

you see McDonald's and I have a long run
in history when I was 23 I thought it'd
be cool to eat at McDonald's in every
country so I did and now I'm 67
countries deep McDonald's in Paris 3000
girls extend as good as it gets
McDonald's in Germany Argentina
McDonald's in Morocco the main reason
why I chase the golden arches is because
it's a cultural experience in itself
menu items change to cater local flavors
and the overall vibe inside McDonald's
is always a surprise from my experiences
no country does McDonald's better than
Thailand so there's a McDonald's right
here then in the metro there's a walk
through window and there's another one
on the other side so within 50 meters
there's three McDonald's as soon as you
enter you're greeted by Ronald McDonald
saying Sawadee Cobb running and then
realize that all employees are just as
welcoming as him it seems that nobody
here hates their job the menu contains
almost everything you can find in the US
but has bonus items like the pork
samurai burger spicy chicken teriyaki
with rice it tastes like I'm eating at a
Chinese restaurant and the sweet corn
pie prices in Thailand are cheaper than
back home a Big Mac set cost 130 baht or
roughly $4 weren't there back in the rez
whereas the same Big Mac set in the US
cost a dollar more in Thailand they have
more sauce options on tap and people
will come throw your trash away when
you're done instead of a drive-through
window Thailand has implemented the walk
through to grab anything on the go buddy
gob one ice cream but if you're at home
and feeling too lazy to get up then
simply dial 1711 for free delivery they
have an English operator making it as
simple as can be how are you then some
guy decked out in a custom McPike will
arrive at your doorstep 24 hours a day
seven days a week it's guaranteed
delivery in 30 minutes or less when it
all comes down to it it's nice to have a
familiar taste of home when you're
eating too much Pad Thai and green curry
McDonald's always comes in the clutch
hey guys thank you for watching and just
to let you know this video was not
